data.text: Anyone Using Tubolito Inner Tubes for Commuting or Touring?
Other than for a spare, is there anybody using Tubolito inner tubes for commuting or touring?
Just as a spare we are tubeless
data.author: Karl Clark

data.text: Yes, I use 700C tubolitos on my road bike, which I also use for commuting and longer tours. Absolutely no problems inside my Continental GP 5000 tyres.
data.author: Ken Neth

data.text: what size tire do you run?
data.author: RobertandTammy Fancher

data.text: 28mm 700C road tyre
data.author: Ken Neth

data.text: All tubolito or pirelli TPU tubes. London, the med, the Alps. Bike never flatted….and true I know it won’t be believed - never pumped up in 2 months on the road - still fine. TPU is clear future. But for everything new: the internet, steam engines, ground oil instead whale oil, iPhones, teslas … people will immediately align with some comfortable judgement based not on their experience but their lack of knowledge. We immediately saw the advantages and have them on 7 bikes.
data.author: Petra Post

data.text: Do you have a favorite brand?
data.author: RobertandTammy Fancher

data.text: I use revoloop, which is similar, but better quality imho. I did use tubolito, but had problems with valves. Revoloop have much better quality valves. I personally use revoloop cc ultra on my gravel bike and daily bike. They are vvery light, excellent puncture resistance. Schwalbe and continental now also make similar lightweight thermoplastic tubes, but I haven't used them
data.author: Andrew Robinson

data.text: I use Schwalbe aerothan on my big road wheels on my gravel bike (not jet) on my profile wheels. Not to much kilometers on them but they preform well. No punctures yet. I do find the valve’s a bit flimsy. But they haven’t failed me.
data.author: Thijs Van de Mortel

data.text: how big of a tire? I plan to run 700c by 38
data.author: RobertandTammy Fancher

data.text: thank you
data.author: RobertandTammy Fancher

data.text: Tubolitos experience with bikes with rim brakes?
data.author: George Manning

data.text: yes I think that the cyclocross and tour Edition are Rim brake compatible I don't think the S models are. I just want to know how flat resistant they are supposed to be a lot better than butyl
data.author: RobertandTammy Fancher

data.text: A much lower price TPU tube is receiving good reviews and is cheap enough to be used regularly. Google RideNow inner tube. Plus the valve stem is black and not orange! Haven’t used them yet personally myself yet.
data.author: Ivan Liew

data.text: now the really weird thing is I was watching a YouTube video on them when I received your message
data.author: RobertandTammy Fancher
